messages.name: PRODUCT_ID
messages.notes: Multi-packet ASCII message with fields: Manufacturer, Product Code, Model Version, Serial Number

signals.name: instance
signals.description: Instance ID of the air conditioner reporting status (1 = first unit, etc.)

signals.name: max_fan_speed
signals.description: Current cap on fan speed due to internal or external limits

signals.name: max_ac_output_level
signals.description: Maximum allowed compressor output (e.g., due to load management or self-protection)

signals.name: dead_band
signals.description: Temperature swing around the setpoint before the compressor cycles

signals.name: second_stage_dead_band
signals.description: Additional offset to trigger a high output mode or second-stage cooling

signals.name: instance
signals.description: Instance ID of the air conditioner reporting status (1 = first unit, etc.)

signals.name: max_fan_speed
signals.description: Current cap on fan speed due to internal or external limits

signals.name: max_ac_output_level
signals.description: Maximum allowed compressor output (e.g., due to load management or self-protection)

signals.name: dead_band
signals.description: Temperature swing around the setpoint before the compressor cycles

signals.name: second_stage_dead_band
signals.description: Additional offset to trigger a high output mode or second-stage cooling

signals.name: instance
signals.description: Zone instance number for this AC unit (0 = apply to all instances)

signals.name: max_fan_speed
signals.description: Limits fan speed output for power-sharing; 255 = don't change

signals.name: max_ac_output_level
signals.description: Limits compressor output; final level may be affected by internal constraints

signals.name: ac_output_level
signals.description: Desired compressor output level; power-sharing and timing delays may alter response

signals.name: dead_band
signals.description: Tolerance band around setpoint; higher values reduce cycling

signals.name: second_stage_dead_band
signals.description: Threshold above setpoint to trigger high-output mode

signals.name: instance
signals.description: Unique ID for each floor heat unit (not tied to thermostat zones)

signals.name: measured_temperature
signals.description: Measured temperature from the floor heat sensor

signals.name: dead_band
signals.description: Allowed temperature deviation before system turns off/on (0.0–25.0°C)

signals.name: transfer_switch_instance
signals.description: Instance ID of the ATS (1–6 valid, 0/7–255 invalid)

signals.name: source_to_use
signals.description: 0–6 = Valid sources; 253 = No source active; Ignored if mode is set to automatic

signals.name: mode
signals.description: 0b = Automatic (source is ignored), 1b = Manual (use selected source)

signals.name: reserved
signals.description: Reserved bits — should be set to 0

signals.name: fault_nak_code
signals.description: Used when rejecting a command; 0 if accepted

signals.name: requesting_source_address
signals.description: Source address of the device requesting the switch

signals.name: instance
signals.description: ATS instance number (1–6 valid, 0 and 7–255 invalid)

signals.name: source_in_use
signals.description: Current input source in use: 0–6 = valid sources, 253 = no source active

messages.name: ATS_AC_STATUS_1
messages.description: Transfer Switch AC Status 1 (RMS voltage/current, frequency, fault flags)

messages.name: ATS_AC_STATUS_2
messages.description: Transfer Switch AC Status 2 (peak voltage/current, ground current, capacity)

signals.name: capacity
signals.description: Configured breaker or current limit capacity

messages.name: ATS_AC_STATUS_3
messages.description: Transfer Switch AC Status 3 (waveform quality, phase sync)

signals.name: phase_status
signals.description: 0001 = In phase (120V only), 0010 = 180° out (240V capable), 0011 = Variable phase, 1110 = Error, 1111 = No data

messages.name: ATS_AC_STATUS_4
messages.description: Transfer Switch AC Status 4 (real/reactive power, harmonics)

signals.name: complementary_leg
signals.description: Instance number of the other leg in a 240V system (0 = none)

signals.name: command
signals.description: 0 = Electric Low Enable, 1 = Disable, 2 = Toggle, 3 = Electric High Enable, 4 = Disable, 5 = Toggle, 6 = Burner Enable, 7 = Disable, 8 = Toggle, 9–13 = Cycle/Test Modes

signals.name: preheat_time
signals.description: Duration of engine preheat in seconds

signals.name: lockout_time
signals.description: Duration in seconds before the heater can retry after a failure

signals.name: max_electric_element_level
signals.description: Maximum available electric element level (typically 1 or 2)

signals.name: electric_low_overcurrent
signals.description: 00 = No overcurrent, 01 = Overcurrent on electric low element

signals.name: electric_low_undercurrent
signals.description: 00 = No undercurrent, 01 = Undercurrent on electric low element

signals.name: electric_low_temperature
signals.description: 00 = Normal temp, 01 = Temp warning on electric low element

signals.name: electric_low_input_status
signals.description: 00 = Inactive, 01 = Active (input present) for electric low

signals.name: electric_high_overcurrent
signals.description: 00 = No overcurrent, 01 = Overcurrent on electric high element

signals.name: electric_high_undercurrent
signals.description: 00 = No undercurrent, 01 = Undercurrent on electric high element

signals.name: electric_high_temperature
signals.description: 00 = Normal temp, 01 = Temp warning on electric high element

signals.name: electric_high_input_status
signals.description: 00 = Inactive, 01 = Active (input present) for electric high

signals.name: instance
signals.description: Pump instance number (0 = all, 1–250 = valid instances)

signals.name: group
signals.description: Group bitmap (bits 0–6 = groups 1–7, 255 = no data, 0 = all groups)

signals.name: operating_status
signals.description: Current output brightness level. Special values: 251 = ramping, 252 = flashing

signals.name: override_status
signals.description: 00 = No external override, 01 = Override active, 11 = Unknown/unsupported

signals.name: desired_level
signals.description: Target brightness level (0–100%); special: 254 = flash, 255 = ignore

signals.name: command
signals.description: 0 = Set level, 1 = Toggle, 2 = Flash, 3 = Fade up/down, 255 = Ignore

signals.name: interlock
signals.description: 00 = No change, 01 = Interlock off, 10 = Interlock on

signals.name: instance
signals.description: 0 = Fresh water, 1 = Black waste, 2 = Gray waste, 3 = LPG, 16+ = Secondary tanks

signals.name: relative_level
signals.description: Tank level as a fraction of full (divide by resolution)

messages.name: SET_DATE_TIME_COMMAND_75
messages.description: Set System Date and Time Command

messages.name: SET_DATE_TIME_COMMAND_9D
messages.description: Set System Date and Time Command

signals.name: group
signals.description: Group bitmap: bits 0–6 for groups 1–7; 0 = all groups; 255 = non-group command

signals.name: desired_level
signals.description: Output level (0–100%). Special values: 250 = Toggle, 251 = Master Memory, 253 = Fault Off, 254 = Error

signals.name: command
signals.description: See Table 6.22.4c. Examples: 0 = Set Level, 1 = On, 2 = On (delay), 3 = Off (delay), 31 = Flash

signals.name: delay_or_duration
signals.description: Delay before command or duration of temporary command. 0 = momentary, 255 = continuous. 241–250 = 5–14 min

signals.name: group
signals.description: Group bitmap (bits 0–6 = groups 1–7, 0 = all, 255 = no data)

signals.name: operating_status
signals.description: Output level (0–100%). Special: 252 = Load delay active

signals.name: operating_mode
signals.description: 00 = Automatic, 01 = Manual (status only changes via command)

signals.name: delay
signals.description: Delay before load becomes active after command. 0–240s or 241–250 for 5–14 min

signals.name: demanded_current
signals.description: Expected current draw of this load

signals.name: present_current
signals.description: Measured current being used by this load

signals.name: override_status
signals.description: 00 = No override, 01 = Override active, 11 = Not supported

signals.name: last_command
signals.description: Most recent command issued to this load (see AC_LOAD_COMMAND)

signals.name: interlock_status
signals.description: 00 = No interlock active, 01 = Interlock active, 11 = Not supported

signals.name: time_zone
signals.description: Time zone offset from UTC in 15-minute increments (e.g. -4 hours = -16)

messages.name: SET_DATE_TIME_COMMAND
messages.description: Set System Date and Time Command

signals.name: time_zone
signals.description: Time zone offset from UTC in 15-minute increments (e.g. -4 hours = -16)

signals.name: dc_instance
signals.description: DC source instance (same meaning as in DC_SOURCE_STATUS_1)

signals.name: device_priority
signals.description: Device priority. 120 = SOC/BMS, 100 = Inverter/Charger, 80 = Charger, 60 = Inverter, etc.

signals.name: state_of_charge
signals.description: Current state of charge (SOC) of the source

signals.name: time_remaining
signals.description: Estimated time to empty or full, depending on interpretation

signals.name: time_remaining_flag
signals.description: 00 = Time to Empty, 01 = Time to Full, 11 = Unspecified (default to Time to Empty)

signals.name: instance
signals.description: Thermostat instance (typically used as zone number)

signals.name: coolant_low_limit
signals.description: Low temperature threshold to trigger heating behavior

signals.name: coolant_high_limit
signals.description: High temperature threshold to trigger cooling behavior

signals.name: status_flags
signals.description: Bitfield representing override, error, or status conditions

signals.name: status
signals.description: Bitfield: generator running, faults, etc. (vendor-specific details)

signals.name: start_battery_voltage
signals.description: Voltage of the generator's start battery

signals.name: shutdown_flags
signals.description: Bitfield: indicates reason for shutdown or faults

signals.name: version
signals.description: ASCII firmware version string. If shorter than 8 bytes, remaining bytes should be 0xFF.

signals.name: schedule_mode_instance
signals.description: Schedule profile index (e.g. 0 = Sleep, 1 = Wake, etc.)

signals.name: day_bitmap
signals.description: Bitmask of days: 0x01 = Sun, 0x02 = Mon, ..., 0x40 = Sat

signals.name: operating_mode
signals.description: 0000 = Off, 0001 = Cool, 0010 = Heat, 0011 = Auto Heat/Cool, 0100 = Fan Only, 0101 = Aux Heat, 0110 = Window Defrost

signals.name: current_schedule_instance
signals.description: Currently active schedule (0 = Sleep, 1 = Wake, 2 = Away, 3 = Return, 250 = Storage)

signals.name: total_schedule_instances
signals.description: Total number of defined schedule instances

signals.name: period_index
signals.description: Which scheduled period is being set (e.g. 0 = Wake, 1 = Sleep)

signals.name: start_time
signals.description: Start time in minutes since midnight (0–1439)

signals.name: manufacturer_code_lsb
signals.description: Least significant byte of Manufacturer Code

signals.name: manufacturer_code_msb
signals.description: Most significant 3 bits of Manufacturer Code

signals.name: firmware_revision
signals.description: Numeric revision number of the device's firmware

signals.name: configuration_type_lsb
signals.description: Least significant byte of configuration type

signals.name: configuration_type_msb
signals.description: Most significant byte of configuration type

signals.name: configuration_revision
signals.description: Revision level of the configuration block

signals.name: instance
signals.description: Instance of transmitter sending ACK/NAK (255 = not multi-instanced)

signals.name: source_address
signals.description: Source address of node being acknowledged

signals.name: dgn_acked
signals.description: The DGN (PGN) that triggered this ACK/NAK
